slides.title: Automatic Reports

content.headline: Know Your Numbers Without the Work

slides.narration: How's your business really doing? Automated reports deliver the answers to your inbox—no spreadsheets, no manual tracking, no guessing. Let's set up the reports that matter.

slides.title: What You'll Set Up
slides.narration: We'll choose the key metrics that actually matter for your business, set up different report types and how often you want them, configure automatic delivery to your inbox, and show you how to act on what you learn.

slides.title: Step 1: Choose Metrics
slides.narration: Choose metrics that matter. Traffic and visibility: views, clicks, impressions. Engagement: inquiries, calls, messages. Conversions: bookings, sales, signups. Reputation: reviews and rating trends. Always include comparison—versus last period and versus your goals. Numbers without context are just numbers.

slides.title: Step 2: Report Types
slides.narration: Set up report types. Weekly snapshot: key metrics summary with week-over-week changes, delivered Monday morning to start your week informed. Monthly deep dive: full analysis with trends and recommendations, first of the month. Alert reports: triggered by specific events like a negative review or traffic spike. Different depths for different needs.

slides.title: Step 3: Delivery Setup
slides.narration: Configure delivery. Email with PDF attachment or inline summary. Dashboard always available for real-time checking. Slack or Teams notification for immediate awareness. Share with team members who need visibility. Pick consistent timing—it builds the habit of checking.

slides.title: Step 4: Take Action

action_framework: Green (above goal): Double down on what's working
content.monthly_review: 15 minutes monthly: What improved? What declined? What to try?

slides.narration: Use the data—reports without action are just email clutter. Green metrics above goal: double down on what's working. Yellow near goal: minor adjustments needed. Red below goal: investigate and fix. Monthly review takes fifteen minutes: What improved? What declined? What should you try differently?

slides.title: Pro Tips

tips: Less is more—focus on 5-7 key metrics
Compare same day last year for seasonal businesses
Set realistic goals before tracking against them

slides.narration: Reporting pro tips. Less is more—focus on five to seven key metrics, not everything available. Compare same day last year if you're seasonal. Set realistic goals before tracking against them. Share wins with your team—data shouldn't only surface problems.

slides.title: Start Getting Reports
slides.narration: Ready to know your numbers without the work? Set up automated reports now. Or see a sample report first to know what you'll get. Insight delivered, no effort required.
